intro: Bupleurum falcatum subf. normale, commonly known as the common valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branching stems that are often covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly aromatic scent. It is commonly found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils.
